Yes, there are many organizations that offer opportunities to volunteer abroad on water and sanitation projects. Here are a few examples:

1. WaterAid - WaterAid offers volunteer opportunities in a range of areas, including advocacy, fundraising, and project implementation. There are opportunities to work on a short-term basis or for longer periods lasting several months.

2. Global Brigades - Global Brigades works on sustainable water, sanitation, and hygiene projects in Latin America, Asia, and Africa. They offer volunteer opportunities for college students and professionals, allowing participants to work alongside local communities and learn about water and sanitation challenges.

3. Engineers Without Borders - Engineers Without Borders is an international nonprofit that works on community-driven development projects. They offer volunteer opportunities for engineers and other professionals to work on water and sanitation projects in developing countries.

4. Water and Sanitation for the Urban Poor - Water and Sanitation for the Urban Poor (WSUP) is a nonprofit organization that works on improving water and sanitation services in cities and towns in developing countries. They offer a range of volunteer opportunities, from fundraising to technical support.

5. AIESEC - AIESEC is a global youth organization with the goal of developing leadership skills and creating positive impact. They offer volunteer opportunities in a range of areas, including sustainable development and water and sanitation projects.

It's important to thoroughly research any volunteering opportunity before committing to it. Make sure the organization aligns with your values and provides a safe and ethical volunteering experience.
